Tomato_Early_Blight.name: Early Blight
Tomato_Early_Blight.symptoms: Dark brown spots with concentric rings on lower leaves

treatment.chemical: Apply Mancozeb or Chlorothalonil fungicide every 7-10 days
treatment.organic: Remove infected leaves, apply neem oil spray, ensure proper spacing

Tomato_Early_Blight.prevention: Crop rotation, avoid overhead watering, mulching

Tomato_Late_Blight.name: Late Blight
Tomato_Late_Blight.symptoms: Water-soaked spots, white mold on leaf undersides

treatment.organic: Remove and destroy all infected plants, do not compost

Tomato_Late_Blight.prevention: Resistant varieties, good air circulation, avoid wet foliage

Tomato_Leaf_Mold.name: Leaf Mold
Tomato_Leaf_Mold.symptoms: Yellow patches on upper leaf, olive-green mold below

treatment.organic: Improve ventilation, reduce humidity, prune lower leaves

Potato_Early_Blight.name: Early Blight
Potato_Early_Blight.symptoms: Brown spots with target-like rings, yellowing leaves

treatment.organic: Remove infected foliage, apply copper spray

Potato_Late_Blight.name: Late Blight
Potato_Late_Blight.symptoms: Dark water-soaked lesions, white fuzzy growth

treatment.organic: Destroy all infected plants, copper fungicide

Corn_Common_Rust.name: Common Rust
Corn_Common_Rust.symptoms: Reddish-brown pustules on both leaf surfaces

treatment.organic: Plant resistant hybrids, remove infected debris

Corn_Gray_Leaf_Spot.name: Gray Leaf Spot
Corn_Gray_Leaf_Spot.symptoms: Rectangular gray-brown lesions parallel to leaf veins

treatment.chemical: Strobilurin or Triazole fungicides at tasseling
treatment.organic: Crop rotation, tillage to bury residue

Rice_Brown_Spot.name: Brown Spot
Rice_Brown_Spot.symptoms: Oval brown spots with gray centers on leaves

treatment.organic: Balanced fertilization, seed treatment with Trichoderma

Rice_Brown_Spot.prevention: Use clean certified seeds, balanced NPK

Rice_Leaf_Blast.name: Leaf Blast
Rice_Leaf_Blast.prevention: Avoid excess nitrogen, use resistant varieties

Tomato_Yellow_Leaf.name: Tomato Yellow Leaf Curl
Tomato_Yellow_Leaf.symptoms: Upward curling of leaflets, yellowing of leaves, stunted plant growth

treatment.chemical: Insecticides to control whitefly vectors (e.g., neonicotinoids, pyrethroids, or organophosphates), although resistance is common. Systemic insecticides are preferred.
treatment.organic: Insecticidal soap or horticultural oil to control whitefly vectors. Remove and destroy infected plants immediately.

Tomato_Yellow_Leaf.prevention: Use virus-free transplants, control whitefly populations with sticky traps and reflective mulches, practice crop rotation, and choose resistant tomato varieties if available.
